name: Little Pied Cormorant
description: It has contrasting coloration—black above and white below, including the neck and head. Its beak is yellow. Within its range, it forms three subspecies differing in the extent of black and white coloration.
image_alt: Little Pied Cormorant, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Length 55–65 cm; wingspan 84–91 cm; weight 490–900 g
attractions: Like other cormorants, it swims skillfully, chasing prey underwater. Its webbed feet act as paddles, driving it forward. It nests in colonies in trees above water. Outside breeding season, it forms smaller groups, but birds do not cooperate during hunting.
breeding: We have kept these cormorants since 2013.
